Module count
Package count.ds

Interface IndexedTree

All Known Implementing Classes:
Phylogeny, TreeTraversal.WellIndexed
public interface IndexedTree
Public interface used by the algorithms: a rooted ordered tree in which every node is assigned a unique index defined by a depth-first traversal. Node indices are consecutive 0,1,...,n-1, where n is the total number of nodes. Leaves are placed at the lower indices: 0,1,...,m-1 are leaves, and indices m, m+1,...,n-1 are ancestral nodes with non-null children. Parent's index is always larger than the child's index; the root has index n-1. Children are ordered by the node's indexing Phylogeny.Node.getChild(int).
Author:
Miklós Csűrös

      Index of the root node.
      Returns:

    • getParent

      int getParent​(int node_idx)
      Index of parent node. Default implementation uses Phylogeny.Node.getParent().
      Parameters:
      node_idx - node index; node may be root
      Returns:
      parent's index; negative value for root

      int getNumChildren​(int node_idx)
      Number of children. Default implementation calls Phylogeny.Node.getNumChildren().

      Returns:
      number of children; 0 for leaf/external node

    • getChild

      int getChild​(int node_idx, int cidx)
      Index of a child node.
      Parameters:
      node_idx - node index;
      cidx - order of the child node (0=left, 1=right for binary); 0..Phylogeny.Node.getNumChildren()-1
      Returns:
      index of that child node; unspecified/exception for bad index

    • isLeaf

      default boolean isLeaf​(int node_idx)
      Test for being a terminal node / leaf. Default implementation calls getNumChildren(int).
      Parameters:
      node_idx - node index
      Returns:
      whether the indexed node is a leaf

    • getLeafNames

      default String[] getLeafNames()
      Array of leaf names (to be used for ordering the columns of the input table)
      Returns:
      a non-null array of leaf names

    • shortestEdgeLength

      default double shortestEdgeLength()
      Shortest positive-length edge in the phylogeny (not considering root's "length").
      Returns:
      Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY if all edges are 0, or a finite positive number

    • longestEdgeLength

      default double longestEdgeLength()
      Longest finite-length edge in the phylogeny (not considering root's "length").
      Returns:
      0.0 if all edges are infinite or 0.0, or else a finite positive number

      default double[] edgeLengthQuantiles()
